content:
• Tuesday, November 27, 2018
  • HAIR

    Restoration Robotics files for $100M mixed shelf offering; shares down 5% after hours

    • Restoration Robotics (NASDAQ:HAIR) has filed a prospectus for a $100M mixed shelf offering.
    • Shares are down 5% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 PM | 14 Comments
  • RCKT

    Rocket Pharma prices stock offering at $15.50

    • Rocket Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RCKT) prices its public offering of 3.55M common shares at $15.50 per share. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 532.5K shares. Closing date is November 30.
    • Today's close was $16.35.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 PM
  • PDS

    Ensign Energy wins bid for Trinidad Drilling; Precision seeks $20M breakup fee

    • Precision Drilling (NYSE:PDS) +4% after-hours as it terminates its agreement to buy Trinidad Drilling (OTCPK:TDGCF) following an announcement by Ensign Energy Services (OTCPK:ESVIF) that 56% of Trinidad shareholders supported its unsolicited all-cash offer for the company.
    • Ensign made a hostile offer for control of Trinidad in August, offering $1.68/share in a deal valued at $947M, then last month PDS and Trinidad jointly announced an all-share deal valued at ~$1B, but a sharp slide in PDS shares caused the value of its offer to slip below Ensign’s cash offer, which ultimately prevailed.
    • PDS says Trinidad now owes it a $20M termination fee, setting up a potential new fight.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • AFSI

    AmTrust says going-private deal gets regulatory OK

    • AmTrust Financial Services (NASDAQ:AFSI) +5.1% after-hours following news that it received all regulatory approvals for its go-private deal, which is now expected to close on Nov. 29.
    • Evergreen Parent LP will acquire the ~45% of AFSI’s issued and outstanding common shares that the Karfunkel and Zyskind families and affiliated parties do not already own or control.
    • At closing, AFSI shareholders will receive $14.75 for each common share they own.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM | 208 Comments
  • NTNX

    CRM, GWPH and NTNX among after hour movers

    • Gainers: NTNX +8.4%. CRM +7.5%. TOWR +5.1%. GFI +4.7%. JILL +4.4%.
    • Losers: ASNS -4.4%. GNL -4.3%. GWPH -4.0%.JAX -3.5%. SIGA -3.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRMD

    CorMedix rebounds 4.2% with insider buys disclosed

    • CorMedix (NYSEMKT:CRMD) is 4.2% higher after hours, rebounding somewhat from a decline of 7.7% today amid some insider buys freshly disclosed.
    • Director Myron Kaplan bought 50,000 shares on Friday at an average price of $1.2959, leaving him with 371,166 shares.
    • Meanwhile, CEO Khoso Baluch bought 3,500 shares yesterday at $1.28 each, and another 21,500 shares today at $1.21, leaving his holdings at 250,373 shares.
    • And Chief Financial Officer Robert Cook bought 25,000 shares today at $1.1685, leaving his holdings at 127,083 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • YY

    YY dips as cautious JPMorgan trims to Neutral

    • YY is 1.5% lower after hours following a downgrade to Neutral from Overweight by a "cautious" JPMorgan.
    • YY Live revenue growth that has been 30% in 2017 and 17% in 2018 should slow to 5% in 2019, amid the lack of new game features and macro headwinds hitting YY's top spenders. The firm's looking for a new catalyst and thinks Bigo consolidation might serve in the next six to 12 months. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • JPMorgan cut its price target to $70 from $85, implying just 2.9% upside from today's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 7 Comments
  • NTNX

    Nutanix +10% on Q1 beats, in-line guide

    • Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX) gains 10.3% after Q1 revenue and EPS beats. In-line Q2 guidance has revenue of $325M to $335M (consensus: $326.51M) and EPS of about -$0.25 (consensus: -$0.26).
    • Revenue breakdown: Product, $224.3M (consensus: $221.8M); Support and Services, $88.9M (consensus: $83.5M).
    • Gross margin came in at 78.6% and operating margin at -8.3% (consensus: -15.1%).
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Nutanix beats by $0.14, beats on revenue (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 12 Comments
  • CRM

    Salesforce +3.7% on Q3 beats, raised FY guide

    • Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) gains 3.7% aftermarket after reporting Q3 beats with EPS of $0.61 and revenue of $3.39B (+26%). Q4 guidance has in-line revenue of $3.551B to $3.561B (consensus: $3.53B) and downside EPS of $0.54 to $0.55 (consensus: $0.57).
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription, $3.17B (consensus: $3.14B); Services, $224M (consensus: $228.1M).
    • Raised FY19 guidance has EPS from $2.60 to $2.61 (prior guidance: $2.50 - $2.52) and revenue from $13.23B to $13.24B (prior: $13.125B - $13.175B).
    • Upside FY20 guidance has revenue from $15.9B to $16B (consensus: $15.83B).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM ET with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.
    • Previously: Salesforce.com beats by $0.11, beats on revenue (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 30 Comments
  • TS

    Tenaris -10% after chairman charged in graft case

    • Tenaris (TS -9.8%) turned sharply lower in the afternoon following reports that the Argentine judge overseeing an investigation into the so-called notebook scandal has charged Chairman and majority shareholder Paolo Rocca as part of a graft case.
    • The judge set a $103M bond and forbade Rocca from leaving the country.
    • The move comes as the judge probes hundreds of alleged bribes paid by construction companies, energy suppliers and electricity generators to members of the former government.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • GNL

    Global Net Lease -3.5% after announcing stock offering

    • Global Net Lease (NYSE:GNL) sinks 3.5% in after-hours trading after announcing the launch of a 4M-share public stock offering.
    • Greenshoe option for an additional 600,000 shares.
    • GNL intends to use the net proceeds from the offering to fund acquisitions, as well as for general corporate purposes.
    • Previously: More on Global Net Lease Q3 results: NOI increases 16% Y/Y (Nov. 7)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 13 Comments
  • GWPH

    GW Pharma FQ4 topline down 1%; FY cash flow down 56%

    • GW Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:GWPH) fiscal Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 2.4 (-1.2%); product sales: 2.3 (-1.1%).
    • Net loss: (79.9) (-48.2%); loss/share: (0.23) (-27.8%); cash flow ops (FY): (231.9) (-55.6%).
    • Meeting with FDA next month to clarify regulatory path for Sativex for multiple sclerosis spasticity.
    • Open-label study of CBDV in Rett syndrome to start next quarter.
    • Phase 2 study of IV CBD in neonatal hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy to start in H1 2019.
    • Shares are up a fraction after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 14 Comments
  • NTNX

    Nutanix beats by $0.14, beats on revenue

    • Nutanix (NASDAQ:NTNX): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.13 beats by $0.14; GAAP EPS of -$0.54 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $313.28M (+13.7% Y/Y) beats by $8.07M.
    • Shares +2.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 24 Comments
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar lifts peers for second straight day after better than expected Q3

    • JinkoSolar (JKS +10.1%) has surged 27% in two days following stronger than expected Q3 results that included a slowdown in planned manufacturing capacity expansions.
    • JKS says it expects a recovery in the China market next year (55-plus GW) as well as growing demand across major markets such as India, U.S. and Europe.
    • China earlier this year cut a key incentive for domestic solar development, weighing on JKS and its competitors, but the pullback may have been less severe than expected; JKS says developers installed 34.5 GW gigawatts in China through September, and the company shipped a record 2.95 GW in Q3 with expectations to ship as much as 4 GW in Q4.
    • Other solar names also are taking off in today's trade: VSLR +9.7%, RUN +7.7%, CSIQ +6.3%, FSLR +3.2%, SPWR +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 13 Comments
  • TRPX

    Therapix Bio down 16% on convertible debt deal

    • Thinly traded nano cap Therapix Biosciences (TRPX -15.9%) is down on below-average volume on the heels of its $2.5M convertible debt placement with a fund managed by Yorkville Advisors Global.
    • The debentures will accrue 5% interest per annum. The first trance of $1.5M was issued on November 23. The remaining tranches of $500K each will be issued after a period of time or in response to certain events. They are convertible at the lower of $7.00 or 95% of the lowest volume-weighted average price during the five consecutive trading days prior to the conversion date.
    • The investor will receive 9,171 ADSs as a commitment fee.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharma shares halted pending news

    • Nasdaq has suspended trading in Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (CPRX -0.3%) pending the release of news, a near-certainty that it pertains to the potential FDA approval of Firdapse for Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome (LEMS). The agency's action date under accelerated review is tomorrow.
    • Update: In a statement, the company says it has not received word from the FDA on the status of its marketing application. Apparently, a contractor working on a web page allowed a screen to be viewed that implied it had received the FDA response.
    • Update: Shares will resume trading at 4:45 pm ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 59 Comments
  • GOOG

    THR: YouTube pulling back from scripted content spending

    • YouTube (GOOG -0.6%, GOOGL -0.6%) is pulling back from scripted content output, a reversal of a strategy that pushed a premium subscription tier, The Hollywood Reporter says.
    • The video platform will cut back starting in 2020, and executive will double down on the ad-supported video by making all its originals free to all users, not just those paying $12/month for YouTube Premium.
    • That means a "serious budget reduction," if not a total pullback from what has been hot competition among distributors for bigger-budget content.
    • The platform might release a show week-to-week for free while giving Premium subscriber the option to binge.
    • YouTube's originals budget (said to be hundreds of millions of dollars a year) is still overshadowed by the billions annually at Netflix (NFLX +1.7%) and Amazon.com (AMZN -0.1%).
    • Also a player here: Hulu, co-owned by Comcast (CMCSA +1.6%), Disney (DIS +1.3%), Fox (FOX +0.6%, FOXA +0.5%) and WarnerMedia (T +1.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 46 Comments
  • PTI

    Positive data from Vertex pressures Proteostasis, down 9%

    • Proteostasis Therapeutics (PTI -8.7%) is down on below-average volume in apparent reaction to positive late-stage data on Vertex Pharmaceuticals' cystic fibrosis (CF) triplet therapy that includes a next-generation corrector.
    • PTI is developing its own triplet therapy for CF. Preliminary Phase 1 data should be available this quarter.
    • Previously: Vertex Pharma's triplet therapy for CF successful in two late-stage studies (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • VZ

    Agfa-Gevaert chooses Verizon for global network transformation

    • Agfa-Gevaert is going with Verizon Enterprise Solutions (VZ +2.2%) for a global network transformation initiative.
    • Verizon's managed network services and software-defined networking will take over net management from Agfa, letting the imaging/IT conglomerate focus on service and solution delivery.
    • Agfa is a longtime Verizon customer.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • CRI

    Carter's moves higher after Gymboree store cut report

    • Carter's (CRI -1.2%) is off its session low after Reuters reports that Gymboree is considering cutting its store base in half.
    • Previously: Gymboree eyes closing half its stores (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • AEMD

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3.00 PM

    • Gainers: Aethlon Medical (NASDAQ:AEMD) +35%. Daqo New Energy (NYSE:DQ) +13%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +12%. AXT (NASDAQ:AXTI) +11%. JinkoSolar Holding (NYSE:JKS) +11%.
    • Losers: Cheetah Mobile (NYSE:CMCM) -31%. Cubic Corporation (NYSE:CUB) -11%. NantHealth (NASDAQ:NH) -11%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -10%. Diebold Nixdorf (NYSE:DBD) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • FANG

    Diamondback Energy, Energen shareholders approve merger

    • Diamondback Energy (FANG +1.1%) and Energen (EGN +1.4%) say all proposals necessary for their pending merger were approved by the respective shareholders of each company at special meetings today, clearing the way for the deal to close by Nov. 29.
    • Under the deal terms, each eligible EGN common share will be converted into the right to receive 0.6442 of a share of FANG common stock.
    • The combined company will own more than 266K net tier one acres in the Permian Basin, an increase of 57% from FANG's current tier one acreage of 170K net acres.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 6 Comments
  • STLD

    Steel stocks in the red as Steel Dynamics' new project to add to U.S. supply

    • Steel names are broadly lower following news of Steel Dynamics' (STLD -8.2%) plans to build a new $1.7B-$1.8B electric arc furnace carbon sheet steel mill in the U.S.: X -8.2%, AKS -3.8%, MT -2.6%, NUE -1.8%.
    • KeyBanc analyst Philip Gibbs expected shares of U.S. carbon sheet-based companies to post losses today on the potential for further U.S. supply growth, and the prospect of more U.S. steel supply likely will weigh on steel prices.
    • Also, "STLD investors may be a bit disappointed via potential for less bandwidth to pursue full-out share buyback momentum ($729M left at September's end)," Gibbs says.
    • Longbow Research lowers its 2019 spot price outlook for hot rolled coil steel by $10 to $15/ton and now calls for 2019 prices of $790-$795/ton, a ~5% drop from 2018 average prices.
    • But Longbow maintains its Buy rating and $40 price target for U.S. Steel, believing the shares are significantly undervalued even after adjusting for potential market headwinds.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 8 Comments
  • PZZA

    Papa John's -11% after Trian passes on bid

    • Papa John's International (NASDAQ:PZZA) is down 10.5% off a Wall Street Journal report indicating that Trian Management is no longer showing an interest in the pizza chain.
    • The company has been shopping itself since August, but has struggled due to the damage to the brand from ex-CEO John Schnatter and the resulting feuding.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • UTX

    United Technologies -5% as forecast for Collins division trails estimates

    • United Technologies (UTX -5.2%) shares suffer their worst loss in three years after the company surprised investors with a weak cash flow forecast from its Collins Aerospace acquisition, spoiling the debut of its long-awaited breakup plan.
    • UTX says the newly formed division from the just-completed $23B purchase of Rockwell Collins will generate no more than $750M of free cash flow next year, far below the ~$1.3B average analyst forecast.
    • Also, UTX says it expects the tax-free separations of Otis Elevator and Carrier to be completed in 18-24 months, slower than anticipated and adding to the pressure on the shares.
    • "The longer spin process may put United Technologies shares at risk of 'spin limbo,'" says Barclays analyst Julian Mitchell, adding that during the period between an announcement and the close of a spinoff, the last 13 industrial stocks to go through the process have underperformed the S&P 500 by 4%.
    • CEO Greg Hayes said in March that one-time separation costs would probably amount to $2B-$3B with most of the expense coming from debt refinancing; in today's conference call, Hayes said the figure would total at least $2.5B.
    • Earlier: United Tech CEO: Focused business tends to do better (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 6 Comments
  • TREC

    Ferroglobe and Jones Energy among Energy/Materials losers; Trecora Resources and Petrobras among the gainers

    • Gainers: Trecora Resources (NYSE:TREC) +9%. Petrobras (NYSE:PBR) +6%. Renewable Energy Group (NASDAQ:REGI) +6%.
    • Losers: Ferroglobe (NASDAQ:GSM) -60%. Jones Energy (OTC:JONE) -42%. Mountain Province Diamonds (NYSEMKT:MPVD) -11%. Mechel PAO (NYSE:MTL) -10%. Earthstone Energy (NASDAQ:ESTE) -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • PFPT

    FBN drops Proofpoint target on billings deceleration

    • FBN Securities maintains an Outperform rating on Proofpoint (NASDAQ:PFPT) but lowers the target by $30 to $105.
    • The firm notes its positive channel checks showed Proofpoint would beat Q3 consensus when the company reported in late October. But the lowered price target was due to FY19 guidance below estimates and a large deceleration in current billings growth.
    • Proofpoint shares are down 1.3% to $89.09.
    • Previously: Proofpoint -12.9% after Q3 beats, COO resignation (Oct. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM

  • Stocks pare losses as U.S.-China trade tensions persist

    • Stocks are still in the red, but pare some earlier losses, as news breaks that the White House and China are holding trade talks at "all levels" ahead of Trump and Xi meeting.
    • Dow -0.2%; S&P 500 -0.2%; Nasdaq -0.3%.
    • Utilities +0.6% is the only major sector in the green. PG&E +6.0% and Edison International +2.3% are the biggest gainers in that group.
    • Meanwhile, industrial goods -1.3%, conglomerates -1.0%, and basic materials -0.9%.
    • Tech giants are still slipping: Apple -1.1%, Amazon -0.5%, Facebook -1.6%.
    • U.S. 10-year Treasury note yield down 1 bp at 3.05%.
    • U.S. dollar rises 0.3% against the euro.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • WPP

    Headline: WPP considered buying Criteo

    • WPP (NYSE:WPP) considered buying Criteo (CRTO +0.7%) last year but had valuation concerns, according to Bloomberg sources.
    • Headline only at the moment but will update when more information becomes available.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly -1.5% on Cyber Monday site issues

    • Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) drops 1.5% as KeyBanc analyst Edward Yruma comments on yesterday's technical issues that disrupted Cyber Monday.
    • The firm notes that the issues disrupted item creation and the checkout process.
    • The company extended its promotion but, as of this morning, the site still wasn't working properly.
    • Source: StreetAccount.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • ABC

    Drug wholesalers in the green on looming close of CVS/Aetna tie-up

    • Drug distributors AmerisourceBergen (ABC +0.4%), McKesson (MCK +3.4%) and Cardinal Health (CAH +1.5%) are all up, albeit on below-average volume, as the finish line approaches for the CVS-Aetna marriage.
    • The consummation of the merger should bode well for the Cigna (CI -0.7%) Express Scripts (ESRX -0.2%) tie-up which investors believe also creates a rosier outlook for additional deals in the pharmacy services space. UnitedHealth Group (UNH +1.1%) is always in the mix as a potential suitor.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • BLMT

    BSB Bancorp leads financial gainers; Marine Petroleum and Community West Bancshares among losers

    • Gainers: BSB Bancorp (NASDAQ:BLMT) +16%. Innovative Industrial Properties (NYSE:IIPR) +11%. PagSeguro Digital (NYSE:PAGS) +7%. CPI Card Group (NASDAQ:PMTS) +7%. LGI Homes (NASDAQ:LGIH) +7%.
    • Losers: EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) -9%. Community West Bancshares (NASDAQ:CWBC) -8%. Income Opportunity Realty Investors (NYSEMKT:IOR) -8%. Marine Petroleum Trust (NASDAQ:MARPS) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • TLTZY

    EC grants unconditional OK to Dutch combo of Deutsche Telekom, Tele2

    • The European Commission has given an uncommon unconditional approval to Deutsche Telekom (DTEGY +0.4%) for its deal to buy the Dutch mobile business of Tele2 (OTCPK:TLTZY).
    • "Our investigation found that the proposed acquisition would not significantly change the prices or quality of mobile services for Dutch consumers," the commission says.
    • That's due in large part to the fact that despite the move dropping the Netherlands' mobile market to three players from four, the combination of the No. 3 and No. 4 players will result in a market share of just under 30%, vs. No. 2 firm Vodafone Ziggo (VOD +1.8%, LBTYA -2.1%) with 30.5%, and leader Royal KPN (KKPNY -1.8%) with 43%.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • WRE

    Washington REIT slumps as JPMorgan cuts price target

    • Washington Real Estate Investment Trust (NYSE:WRE) falls 4.9% in early afternoon trading after JPMorgan trims its price target to $28 from $32, noting WRE's leasing update reveals "notable 2019 drags."
    • Analyst Anthony Paolone estimates the REIT's office portfolio occupancy will lessen by about 300 basis points, on average, next year vs. 2018 levels.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word.
    • Analyst ratings: 2 buys; 4 holds; 0 underperform/sell.
    • Previously: Washington REIT is said to be shopping its retail portfolio: Bloomberg (Sept. 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • SDLP

    Seadrill Partners wins $11M rig deal with Petronas

    • Seadrill Partners (SDLP -3.9%) says it has secured a contract for its West Capella drillship for one well with two options with Petronas in Malaysia.
    • SDLP expects backlog for the firm portion of the contract of ~$11M, and commencement is expected in Q3 2019.
    • The rig currently is drilling for Shell in Malaysia under a five-well contract signed in July, with the backlog excluding options expected to total $32M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • ASNS

    Healthcare & Tech dominate midday movers

    • Gainers: Arsanis (NASDAQ:ASNS) +81%. Sphere 3D (NASDAQ:ANY) +22%. Aethlon Medical (NASDAQ:AEMD) +19%. Cocrystal Pharma (NASDAQ:COCP) +19%. Bluegreen Vacations (NYSE:BXG) +16%. BSB Bancorp (NASDAQ:BLMT) +16%. CohBar (NASDAQ:CWBR) +15%. Spirit Airlines (NASDAQ:SAVE) +15%. Aileron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ALRN) +13%. Daqo New Energy (NYSE:DQ) +12%.
    • Losers: Ferroglobe (NASDAQ:GSM) -60%. Cheetah Mobile (NYSE:CMCM) -20%. G1 Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GTHX) -20%. Therapix Biosciences (NASDAQ:TRPX) -17%. FTE Networks (NYSEMKT:FTNW) -16%. Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN) -16%. Income Opportunity Realty Investors (NYSEMKT:IOR) -14%. ReShape Lifesciences (OTC:RSLS) -15%. Alta Mesa Resources (NASDAQ:AMR) -14%. Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY) -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • CAMP

    CalAmp, Telefonica team on telematics supply deal

    • CalAmp (CAMP -1.7%) and Telefonica (TEF +0.1%) have set a major global supply agreement for intelligent telematics devices.
    • Telefonica will offer "IoT in a Box" bundles that will include CalAmp's fleet and asset tracking devices along with Telefonica connectivity/visibility tools. Targets of the bundled services include fleet operators, vehicle financiers, auto dealers, insurers and rental car companies.
    • The deal provides devices for fleet and asset management in Mexico at first, with expected expansion across other Latin American and European markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • AMZN

    AWS using more efficient ARM server chips

    • Amazon (AMZN +0.4%) Web Services begins using more efficient ARM-based server chips with the AWS Graviton Processors announced at the re:Invent conference.
    • Amazon says the processors are optimized for scale-out workloads that can spread across multiple smaller instances.
    • The first set of instances (A1) is now available in select regions in the U.S. and Europe.
    • AWS is moving to its Nitro System, which provides a framework for building instance types faster.
    • Earlier this month, AWS announced support for AMD's (AMD +6.2%) EPYC processors.
    • Previously: AMD +5.6% on Next Horizon event, AWS instances announcement (Nov. 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 61 Comments
  • COCP

    CoCrystal Pharma up 18%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cocrystal Pharma (COCP +17.6%) is up on modestly higher volume. Shares have more than doubled since touching $1.51 on November 5.
    • Two weeks ago, President Sam Lee, Ph.D., presented preclinical data on influenza A candidate CC-42344 at a respiratory virus conference in Washington, DC.
    • On the working capital front, at the end of September, it had $4.7M in cash while operations consumed $6.3M ytd from January 1.
    • In July, the company inked a $10M stock sales agreement with Ladenburg Thalmann whose chairman is Dr. Phillip Frost, currently one of the targets in a stock fraud investigation. He is also on the board of COCP.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • STKL

    SunOpta leads consumer gainers; Fossil Group and Orchids Paper Products among losers

    • Gainers: SunOpta (NASDAQ:STKL) +12%. China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS) +6%.
    • Losers: G-III Apparel Group (NASDAQ:GIII) -9%. Fossil Group (NASDAQ:FOSL) -7%. Orchids Paper Products (NYSEMKT:TIS) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • WGO

    RV industry expected to see drop in 2019

    • RV shipments will fall in 2019 to a range of 439.8K to 466K units from this year's estimated level of 479K and the 504.6K shipments recorded in 2017, according to a forecast from Richard Curtin of the University of Michigan Survey Research Center.
    • "Income, employment, and household wealth will continue to exert a positive force on RV sales, though these factors are expected to be slightly less favorable in the year ahead," updates Curtin.
    • Last month, RV sales were down 11% Y/Y (per Bloomberg).
    • Sector watch: Winnebago (WGO -2.9%), Thor Industries (THO -2.1%), LCI Industries (LCII +0.4%), Patrick Industries (PATK +0.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 29 Comments
  • GOLD

    Egyptian billionaire eyes Barrick’s African gold mines after Randgold merger

    • Egyptian billionaire Naguib Sawiris outlines plans to build a new African-focused gold company and says he would be interested in buying any gold mines on the continent put up for sale by Barrick Gold (ABX -2.8%) following its merger with Randgold (GOLD -2.7%).
    • Sawiris tells the Mines and Money conference in London that he wants to use Ghana-based gold miner Golden Star, in which he bought a 30% stake in August, as a vehicle to acquire underground gold mines, mainly in east Africa.
    • He says he met ABX CEO John Thornton recently in New York and expressed his interest in buying some of the company’s African mines.
    • Analysts have speculated that ABX could sell Randgold’s Tongon, Massawa and Morila mines in Africa after the deal closes at the end of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 13 Comments
  • ALRN

    Aileron up 14% on study collaboration with Pfizer

    • Thinly traded nano cap Aileron Therapeutics (ALRN +14%) is up on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 187K shares, on the heels of its announced collaboration with Pfizer (PFE +0.4%) on a clinical trial evaluating the combination of lead candidate ALRN-6924 and IBRANCE (palbociclib) in MDM2-amplified cancers.
    • The Phase 1b study in patients with solid tumors will launch next quarter. Aileron will conduct the trial while Pfizer will supply product.
    • ALRN-6924 is a cell-permeating peptide that mimics the p53 tumor suppressor protein to disrupt the interaction with proteins that interfere with its action called MDMX and MDM2.
    • Palbociclib inhibits two enzymes, CDK4 and CDK6, that play key roles in the cell cycle. Blocking their action interferes with cancer cell proliferation.

    • Gold Fields (GFI -2.8%) says it has acted in good faith and that the planned cuts of ~1,100 employees, 30% of its workforce, at its South Deep mine are a "last resort."
    • The statement follows comments yesterday from Mineral Resources Minister Mantashe that GFI had not acted in good faith in talks with the government about the job cuts, in a setback for negotiations aimed at ending a weeks-long strike.

    • Meanwhile, GFI says it recently engaged with NUM on a proposed settlement agreement aimed at resolving the strike at South Deep; the union has until the end of this week to accept the proposed settlement.

    • Ferroglobe (NASDAQ:GSM) -32.1% pre-market after posting wide misses on Q3 earnings and revenues; Q3 adjusted EBITDA of $45M was 48% lower than Q2's $86.3M and 20% below $56.1M in the year-ago quarter.

    • GSM says it is curtailing production in its silicon metal and manganese-based alloys businesses to focus on its most cost effective plants and geographies.
    • "The deterioration in market conditions during the quarter left us with elevated inventories, a key factor in our decision to curtail our production," GSM says. "Given our Q3 results, our free cash flow targets for the second half of 2018 have become a 'stretch' goal."
